channel.title: One starter?
channel.description: How do i make it to where you can only get one starter?

item.title: One starter?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

[quote=“yeoldhag, post:2, topic:353223”]Make a variable called started. Make it so starter must = 0 in order for your starter command to work. Then make it so when you type starter, it sets variable starter = 1.

If you want me to spoon feed you on how to do this just ask me.[/quote]

where do you go to make a variable? this is my code:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0 ) { addItem(995,100000); addItem(556,1000); addItem(555,1000); addItem(557,1000); addItem(554,1000); addItem(558,350); addItem(1153,1); addItem(1115,1); addItem(1067,1); addItem(1323,1); addItem(3842,1); addItem(1725,1); addItem(6568,1); addItem(1267,1); addItem(1349,1); addItem(3105,1); sendMessage("starter pack!"); starter = 1; savemoreinfo(); savechar(); } if (starter == 2) { sendMessage("You've already got your starter pack!"); } PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " tried to get an extra starter pack! Nurd.");

Read full topic

item.title: One starter?
item.dc:creator: @yeoldhag yeoldhag
item.description:
@yeoldhag wrote:

Make a variable called started. Make it so starter must = 0 in order for your starter command to work. Then make it so when you type starter, it sets variable starter = 1.

If you want me to spoon feed you on how to do this just ask me.

Read full topic
